verb.description: Live or spend a period of time in a dull, inactive, unchallenging way.
examples: if she left him there alone, he'd sit in front of the television set and vegetate

verb.description: (of a plant or seed) grow; sprout.
(of an abnormal growth) increase in size.

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin vegetat- enlivened, from the verb vegetare, from vegetus active, from vegere be active.
